author: Xiang Rizheng
notes: Xiang Rizheng [向日征]. 1999. A Study of Jiwei Miao [吉卫苗语硏究]. Chengdu: Sichuan Nationalities Publishing House.Qo Xiong, or North Hmongic, is a divergent Hmongic language (or languages) spoken in western Hunan, China, and neighboring regions as well. The selected dialect is that of Layiping (腊乙坪), Jiwei Township (吉卫镇), Huayuan County, Hunan Province, China.
